item.description:
In December, how about a photo session? I'll bring a MAC LAPTOP AND PLUGIN projector, please write in if you'd like to bring some pics of China to show the group. Put it on the message board or "contact me" through the website.
SINCE YOU ASKED: photo limit- please choose your 10 best pics and have something to say about them in MAndarin, no matter how simple! Feel free to rbing all the rest of your photos, plan for 5-10 minutes each person, if we have more time we can add some, or do this again with another set of pics.
-If several people have photo albums, let's break into smaller groups and rotate.

-NEW ACTIVITY: Anyone want to make a holiday greeting card for the adults in our sister group in Shanghai, the English Cub at the Shanghai Y? I'll bring paper and pens. Maybe Edwin will take them for us :)

INFO will be available on the new Saturday beginner intensive Mandarin course which starts in January at our host site BCNC. Since it's a new program, let's help spread the word to anyone looking to start Mandarin studies.

Note: I'm selling things to benefit exchange with the Shanghai Y- apologies if this is not appropriate to mention here. I'll bring some in case anyone is interested in learning about it, fair trade organic coffee and souvenirs from China. All proceeds are being donated through the World Service YMCA.

Mandarin Conversation group Meetup.
Monthly meeting to practice Mandarin conversation. Learners of all levels, and native speakers welcome!
This is an opportunity to meet with other learners and practice whatever you'd like to work on. Bring any books or homework you would like to review, and ask a native speaker to help you with pronounciation.
------------
BCNC is at 38 Ash St. is off Oak St, at the interesection of Washington St., between Kneeland and Marginal Way.
The closest T stop is New England Medical Center.
Walk toward the South End (away from Chinatown) on Washington St and take the first left onto Oak St. The entrance to the building is in Ash St., the first small street on the left. There's a sign for BCNC- Boston Chinatown Neighborhood Center. Sign in at the front desk and ask for the Meetup conversation group.
Parking is limited in the area, due to the theater district, but sometimes you can find spaces on the surrounding blocks. There are pay lots on Kneeland and Tremont Streets.
The phone number in case you get lost is 617-635-5129.

For more information, see http://www.bcnc.net...

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

item.name: The Boston Chinese Language December Meetup
